page.title: 11National Garden Festival
page.content: Very few people would have thought that Anyone would have spent an enjoyable day on the derelict land left after the Shelton Steelworks closure which left 2,000 men from the steelworks unemployed. The total cost of the reclamation work on the old Shelton Steelworks was over 7.5 million pounds. 1.5 million cubic metres of earth and rubble was removed from the site along with 145.0 square metres of slurry. The garden festival which opens on May 1st to October 26th 1986 intends to have a two and a half mile railway,an 80 berth marina,a specially designed palm house with exotic plants and an exhibition in Eturia Hall by Wedgwood and Doulton.
